title: What â€œIce in My Veinsâ€ Means & Why It's So Popular

steps.title: â€œIce in my veinsâ€ means you're â€œcold-bloodedâ€ or â€œcalm under pressure.â€
steps.content: â€œIce in my veinsâ€ means you're â€œcold-bloodedâ€ or â€œcalm under pressure.â€ In the sports world, â€œice in my veinsâ€ is used to describe skillful players who donâ€™t fold under pressure, especially during the last few minutes of a match that could make or break the game. Itâ€™s often associated with basketball, thanks to Los Angeles Lakers player Dâ€™Angelo Russell, who began pointing to the veins in his forearms as a celebratory pose back in 2016. [1] X Research source The expression â€œice in my veinsâ€ (or sometimes â€œice water in my veinsâ€) was a little-known English idiom until it was popularized by Russell.

steps.title: Extend one arm downward, then point at the veins on your extended arm.
steps.content: Extend one arm downward, then point at the veins on your extended arm. Keep your extended arm straight and relaxed, and position your hand so itâ€™s flat and your palm is facing outward. With the opposite hand, use your index and middle fingers to gesture toward the veins on the inside of your arm. Throw out a cool and confident expression, like a wink or lip bite, to enhance the effect and look extra cold-blooded. If you want to dap someone up like LeBron and D-Lo , slap your friend's right hand with your right hand, then slap the back of their right hand with the back of your right hand. Wrap your thumb around the crook of their thumb, gently squeeze, then let go and flash the ice in my veins pose.

steps.title: The â€œice in my veinsâ€ pose was created by Dâ€™Angelo Russell.
steps.content: The â€œice in my veinsâ€ pose was created by Dâ€™Angelo Russell. On March 1, 2016, Los Angeles Lakers player Dâ€™Angelo Russell scored 39 points against the New York Nets. After shooting a three-pointer with 30 seconds left in the game, Russell celebrated by pointing at his forearm and shouting â€œice in my veinsâ€ (which you can see here ). [2] X Research source On November 22, 2016, Lakers player Nick Young paid tribute to Russell by flashing the pose after scoring a three-pointer during the last 10 seconds of the game against the Oklahoma City Thunder.

steps.title: The â€œice in my veinsâ€ pose went viral on TikTok in early 2021.
steps.content: The â€œice in my veinsâ€ pose went viral on TikTok in early 2021. While itâ€™s unclear who started the â€œice in my veinsâ€ trend on TikTok, users started using the pose in various videos. Rather than referring to the final moments of a basketball game, pointing to the â€œice in your veinsâ€ on TikTok means youâ€™re telling the truth or being authentic. Itâ€™s often featured in â€œIt Started with a Heyâ€ challenge videos , which is used to compare 2 people with different personalities. [3] X Research source The â€œice in my veinsâ€ pose is also called the â€œTikTok Arm Thing,â€ for people who are unfamiliar with its origins. Some TikTokers use the â€œice in my veinsâ€ pose to humorously and ironically refer to something as cold-blooded.
